attributes.action: Stop increasing corporation tax on small companies
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Throughtout the country, thousands of small businesses operate through limited companies.  The Chancellor encouraged this in 2002 with the introduction of the £10,000 "nil" rate band.  However, this has been removed and he is now increased corporation tax; to 20% from 1.4.07, 21% from 1.4.08 and 22% from 1.4.09.  This is grossly unfair for a sector which provides many thousands of jobs and output for the economy.  These organisations have to struggle with red tape and quite often take a risk by being entrepreneurial, and therefore an increase in corporation tax is (a) a slap in the face and (b) a message to anyone wanting to work for themselves - don't expect any favours.

We believe the previous rate of corporation tax, 19%, to be fair and ask that it is reinstated as such.

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several already in existence -
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/SmallBusinessTax/
